1.text: But the Lord, responding to Job from a whirlwind, said:

2.text: Who is this that wraps sentences in unskilled words?

3.text: Gird your waist like a man. I will question you, and you must answer me.

4.text: Where were you, when I set the foundations of the earth? Tell me, if you have understanding.

5.text: Who set its measurements, if you know, or who stretched a line over it?

6.text: Upon what have its bases been grounded, and who set forth its cornerstone,

7.text: when the morning stars praised me together, and all the sons of God made a joyful noise?

8.text: Who enclosed the sea with doors, when it broke forth as if issuing from the womb,

9.text: when I stationed a cloud as its garment and wrapped it in a mist as if swaddling an infant?

10.text: I encircled it with my limits, and I positioned its bars and doors.

11.text: And I said: “This far you will approach, and you will proceeded no further, and here you will break your swelling waves.”

12.text: Did you, after your birth, command the birth of the sun and show the sunrise its place?

13.text: And did you hold the extremities of the earth, shaking them, and have you shaken the impious out of it?

14.text: The seal will be restored like clay, and it will remain in place like a garment.

15.text: From the impious, the light will be taken away, and the exalted arm will be broken.

16.text: Have you entered the depths of the sea, and have you taken a walk in the uttermost parts of the abyss?

17.text: Have the gates of death been opened to you, and have you seen the doors of darkness?

18.text: Have you considered the breadth of the earth? If you know all things, reveal them to me.

19.text: Which is the way that holds the light, and which is the place of darkness?

20.text: In this way, you might lead each thing to its final place, and understand the paths of its house.

21.text: So then, did you know when you were to be born? And did you know the number of your days?

22.text: Have you been admitted into the storehouses of the snows, and have you gazed upon the stockpile of the brimstone,

23.text: which I have prepared for the time of the enemy, for the day of the battle and the war?

24.text: In what way is the light scattered, and the heat distributed, over the earth?

25.text: Who gave a course to the rainstorms, and a path to the resounding thunder,

26.text: so that it would rain on the earth far from man, in the wilderness where no mortal lingers,

27.text: so that it would fill impassable and desolate places, and would bring forth green plants?

28.text: Who is the father of rain, or who conceived the drops of dew?

29.text: From whose womb did the ice proceed, and who created the frost from the air?

30.text: The waters are hardened to become like stone, and the surface of the abyss freezes over.

31.text: Will you have the strength to join together the sparkling stars of the Pleiades, or are you able to disperse the circling of Arcturus?

32.text: Can you bring forth the morning star, in its time, and make the evening star rise over the sons of the earth?

33.text: Do you know the order of heaven, and can you explain its rules here on the earth?

34.text: Can you lift up your voice to the clouds, so that an onslaught of waters will cover you?

35.text: Can you send forth lightning bolts, and will they go, and on returning, say to you: “Here we are?”

36.text: Who placed discernment in the guts of man, or who gave the rooster intelligence?

37.text: Who can describe the rules of the heavens, or who can put to rest the harmony of heaven?

38.text: When was the dust cast to become the earth, and when were its clods fastened together?

39.text: Will you seize prey for the lioness, and will you sustain the lives of her young,

40.text: as they rest in their dens or lie in wait in pits?

41.text: Who provides the raven with its meal, when her chicks cry out to God, as they wander around because they have no food?
